math_problem: Simplify: $2 \sqrt{1.5+\sqrt{2}}-(1.5+\sqrt{2})$. Instead of determining the simplified value of the given algebraic expression, simply find $k = \sqrt{4} - 1$, where $\sqrt{4}$ is the rational component in the denested form of the nested square root derived from the structural analysis of the expression. Find a nonzero monic polynomial $P(x)$ with integer coefficients and minimal degree such that $P(k-\sqrt[3]{2}+\sqrt[3]{4})=0$. (A polynomial is called monic if its leading coefficient is 1.)

A939: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Algebra -> Equations and Inequalities
